div.l: Sithik quod he I ful wel shal the quite
With blering of a proud Millers yhe
If that me list to speke of ribaudie
But ik am olde me list nat pleie for age
Gras tyme is gon my foder is now forage
This white top writeth myn olde yeres
Myn hert is also mouled as myn heres
But yit I fare as doth an Openars
That ik fruit is euer lenger the wers
Til it be roten in mullok or in stre
We olde men I drede so fare we
Til we be roten can we nat be ripe
We hoppe alwey whil that the world wol pipe
For in oure will there stiketh euer a naill
To haue an hore heer and a grene taill
As hath a leek for thouȝ oure miȝt begon
Oure will desireth folie euer in oon̄
For whan we may nouȝt don than wol we speke
Yit in oure asshen olde fire is yreke
Foure gledes han we wich I shal deuise
Auaunting angre lyeng couetise
These iiij sparcles longeth vnto the elde
Oure olde lymmes mow wel ben vnwelde
But will ne shal nat faile that is soth
And yit haue I alwey a coltissh toth
As many a yere as it is passid henne
Sith that my tappe of lif began to renne
For sikerli whan I was born anon
Deth drouȝ the tappe of lif and let it gon̄
And euer sith hath so the tappe I ronne
Til almost al empti is the tonne
The streme of lif now droppeth on the chimbe
The seli tunge e may euil ringe ⁊and chimbe
Of wrecchidnesse that passid is ful yore
With olde folk saue dotage is nomore
Whan that oure oost had herd this sermoning
He gan to speke as lordli as a king
And seid what amounteth al this wit
Whi shal we alday speke of holi writ
The deuell made a Reue for to preche
Or a souter · a shipman or a leche
Sey forth thi tale and tarie nat the tyme
